items.title: Air Transat cancels 6 flights in anticipation of pilots' strike deadline
items.summary_auto: With less than 24 hours until a potential pilots' strike, Air Transat has cancelled six flights that were scheduled for Tuesday, the airline confirmed to CBC News in an email.

items.title: ICC sentences Sudanese militia leader to 20 years in prison for Darfur atrocities
items.summary_auto: Judges at the International Criminal Court sentenced a leader of the feared Sudanese Janjaweed militia to 20 years imprisonment Tuesday for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed in the catastrophic conflict in Darfur more than two decades ago.

items.title: Zelenskyy in Italy as he continues to marshal support for more favourable peace plan
items.summary_auto: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with Pope Leo XIV near Rome on Tuesday and was scheduled for talks with Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, as he continued to rally European support for Ukraine while resisting U.S. pressure for a painful compromise with Russia on a peace plan to end the war.

items.title: Canadian swim star Penny Oleksiak denies drug use, says she'll keep training despite 2-year suspension
items.summary_auto: A two-year suspension from competitive swimming has forced Penny Oleksiak to answer questions about drug use, train by herself in public pools and defend her legacy as Canada’s most decorated female Olympian.

items.title: 'Like dog poo': Historic N.S. garden gets a smelly surprise from tree
items.summary_auto: Annapolis Royal Historic Gardens staff initially dismissed a suggestion by a visitor that their 40-year-old ginkgo tree had suddenly started producing stinky seeds.

items.title: Co-accused testifies at Ontario murder trial for 1st time. ‘I always wanted them,’ she says of brothers
items.summary_auto: Taking the witness box in her first-degree murder trial, Brandy Cooney says she called the boy she was trying to adopt a “moron” and “loser,” used zip-ties to confine him in a wetsuit and locked him in his room at a Burlington, Ont., home.

items.title: The rise of the electrostate: By dominating clean energy, China is leading on climate action
items.summary_auto: China’s massive lead in clean technologies has shifted the climate fight from one of big pledges and international diplomacy toward a technological revolution in cheaper energy, analysts say.

items.title: Can Carney still put together a credible climate plan? Does it matter?
items.summary_auto: If Mark Carney's first nine months as prime minister have revealed a difference of opinion over how the federal government should go about fighting climate change, he now has to prove that his approach can put Canada on a credible path to net-zero emissions by 2050.

items.title: 'Not going to stop until I find him': First Nation man's family search for more remains in Ontario murder case
items.summary_auto: Ontario Provincial Police have stopped looking for the rest of Mekhi Pelly’s remains as two people face charges in the murder case, but the Kenora-area man's family vows to keep searching. Here's what we know about the investigation as a range of people, including from Manitoba, help in the search.

items.title: New pictures show changes in fugitive Ryan Wedding’s appearance
items.summary_auto: U.S. authorities have released two new photos of Canadian fugitive Ryan Wedding, as the FBI intensifies its search for the alleged drug kingpin.

items.title: Inquest begins on wrong-way Highway 1 crash in Chilliwack, B.C., that led to 3 deaths
items.summary_auto: A B.C. Coroners Service inquest has begun looking into the circumstances of a crash that led to three deaths five years ago. The Independent Investigations Office of B.C. cleared an RCMP officer who was pursuing a suspect in the case.

items.title: See the moment a Hawaii volcano's eruption knocked out a remote camera
items.summary_auto: A remote camera on Hawaii's erupting Kīlauea volcano captured the moment a lava fountain engulfed it and knocked it offline on Saturday. Kilauea, one of the world's most active volcanoes, has been erupting intermittently since Dec. 23, 2024.

items.title: Japan leads the world in responding to earthquakes. Here's why
items.summary_auto: The latest earthquake in Japan on Dec. 8, which triggered widespread shaking and tsunami alerts, served as another clear example of the nation’s world-leading earthquake response efforts. CBC’s Johanna Wagstaffe explores the factors that make Japan stand out and the lessons other earthquake-prone countries can learn from their approach.

items.title: Country singer Corb Lund gets OK to launch anti-coal petition drive in Alberta
items.summary_auto: Alberta singer Corb Lund has been given the go-ahead to start collecting signatures for a petition to ask the province to pass a law banning new coal mining on the eastern slopes of the Rocky Mountains.

items.title: B.C. to launch inquest into fatal police shooting of Surrey teen with autism and ADHD
items.summary_auto: The B.C. Coroners Service will begin an inquest next year into the fatal police shooting of a 15-year-old boy in Surrey in February.

items.title: Ancient boat unearthed off the coast of Egypt believed to be a ‘pleasure barge’ fit for a king
items.summary_auto: Long before modern billionaires threw lavish parties at sea on their superyachts, the wealthy elite of ancient Egypt traversed the river Nile in luxury on their pleasure barges. Now, for the first time, archeologists believe they have unearthed one of those opulent vessels of yore from beneath the sediment off the coast of Alexandria.

items.title: ABC signs Jimmy Kimmel to a 1-year contract extension, months after temporary suspension
items.summary_auto: U.S. President Donald Trump won't be getting his wish. ABC said Monday it has signed late-night comic Jimmy Kimmel to a one-year contract extension.

items.title: Heat point guard Terry Rozier pleads not guilty in sports betting case
items.summary_auto: Miami Heat player Terry Rozier pleaded not guilty Monday to charges he helped gamblers placing bets on his performance in NBA games.

items.title: Government to soon have 'sharper view' on public servants' return to office, says Carney
N.S., Ontario had highest rates of human trafficking in 2024: StatsCan
items.summary_auto: Women and girls are more likely to be victims, making up over 90 per cent of victims in the last decade.

items.title: More Canadians have a family doctor, but 'concerning gaps' found
items.summary_auto: More Canadians have a family doctor or nurse practitioner compared with three years ago, though satisfaction remains low, a comprehensive new survey suggests.
